cluster_relations.rel_desc: Social media enables amplification of individuals' voices.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject provides functionality or affordances that make it possible for the amplification of voices or perspectives in public discourse.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Marginalization, Representation & Inclusion in Social Media

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Social media gives a voice to marginalized groups previously silenced or ignored.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject increases the audibility, visibility, or reach of the object's voice or perspectives in public discourse.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Marginalization, Representation & Inclusion in Social Media

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Mainstream media has historically silenced or ignored marginalized groups.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject diminishes, silences, or neglects the object's voice or perspectives in public discourse.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Marginalization, Representation & Inclusion in Social Media

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Empowerment of marginalized voices results in amplification of diverse voices.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject increases the audibility, visibility, or reach of the object's voice or perspectives in public discourse.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Marginalization, Representation & Inclusion in Social Media
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Marginalization, Representation & Inclusion in Social Media

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: when social media is harnessed for good

remarks: Relation inferred to connect two separately mentioned but conceptually related effects.
Relation inferred to connect two separately mentioned but conceptually related effects.
Relation inferred to connect two separately mentioned but conceptually related effects.
Relation inferred to connect two separately mentioned but conceptually related effects.

args.justification: All four relations concern whether and how different media or empowerment processes make marginalized or diverse voices present/audible in public discourse. While there is a causal mechanism, the primary semantic dimension is representational visibility and voice (who is heard, amplified, or silenced). Using a rel_cls_group of 'REPRESENTATION' better captures this core dimension than the more generic 'CAUSALITY', while the causal nature is already reflected in the canonical descriptions.
args.remark: Shifted broad grouping from CAUSALITY to REPRESENTATION to emphasize the core semantic focus on visibility and presence of voices rather than generic cause-effect.

executed_decisions.justification: All four relations concern whether and how different media or empowerment processes make marginalized or diverse voices present/audible in public discourse. While there is a causal mechanism, the primary semantic dimension is representational visibility and voice (who is heard, amplified, or silenced). Using a rel_cls_group of 'REPRESENTATION' better captures this core dimension than the more generic 'CAUSALITY', while the causal nature is already reflected in the canonical descriptions.
executed_decisions.remark: Shifted broad grouping from CAUSALITY to REPRESENTATION to emphasize the core semantic focus on visibility and presence of voices rather than generic cause-effect.
